Colin Powell talks about the Henry Louis Gates arrest with Larry King . He said the story "went viral" when Barack Obama commented on the story. Also, Colin Powell thinks that America "isn't quite post-racial" at this time. These problems still exist in post-racial America. However, he suggested that Henry Louis Gates should not have argued with the policeman arresting him. "You don't argue with a police officer," he says. Day-to-day adult That's Eric Schmidt : So long to the Google Inc. chief who wasn't For six years, Larry Page and Sergey Brin told Eric Schmidt that Google Inc. should build its own browser, and for six years, he resisted. " Google Inc. was a small company, Eric Schmidt remembered. "Having come through the bruising browser wars, I didn't want to do that again."
